page.title: 15A CAMPTON SMALL FARM
page.content: The first William Lamb came here in 1805.Ever since then it has always been farmed by a William Lamb, going from father to son. The present William Lamb farms 120 acres at Campton Bury and 20 acres at Meppershall. The crops to be harvested this year are:- Winter wheat 125 acres Winter barley 43 acres. The remaining land is grass which is eaten by three ponies.Sometimes,in other years, different crops are grown,such as beans,brussels and potatoes. Mr Lamb farms the land himself except at harvest time, and then he employs a man to cart the corn while he drives the combine harvester.The grain is then sold to the millers.
